channel.title: More than 32entries in preset, skipping
channel.description: so is a preset limited to 32 entries? And can this be lifted? I have a lot of parameters in each preset, because I'm using several instances of the same "voice" subpatch, because each voice is addressed at a different midi channel and each of these subpatches has 13 parameters. I assigned those 13 parameters to presets on one instance, and then copied it a few times, hoping that those assignments would be copied along, which seemed to be the case, but now I get this error... I suppose there's no way to turn that into one polyphonic subpatch that listens for midi notes on several midi channels?

item.title: More than 32entries in preset, skipping
item.dc:creator: @timvets TimVets
item.description:
@timvets wrote:

Subpatch mode: polyphonic multichannel,
problem solved... sorry for the noise

Read full topic

item.title: More than 32entries in preset, skipping
item.dc:creator: @timvets TimVets
item.description:
@timvets wrote:

so is a preset limited to 32 entries? And can this be lifted?
I have a lot of parameters in each preset, because I'm using several instances of the same "voice" subpatch, because each voice is addressed at a different midi channel and each of these subpatches has 13 parameters.
I assigned those 13 parameters to presets on one instance, and then copied it a few times, hoping that those assignments would be copied along, which seemed to be the case, but now I get this error...
I suppose there's no way to turn that into one polyphonic subpatch that listens for midi notes on several midi channels?
